messageBody:
Tony Gunter wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Yes: build your EJBs as a thin layer around the /real/ work, so you
> can
> > test the guts outside the container. _JUnit Recipes_, chapter 13.
>
> I am with you there 100%. But as a compromise, I have agree to set up
> Maven and Cactus to automatically perform in-container unit tests on
> those thin-layer EJB's until I can prove to the fellow in charge that
> it hurts more than it helps (to unit test continuously, instead of
> integration test at the end).
>
> I suppose my question is... just how bad is this going to hurt? :)
> Will I really end up in a straightjacket?

Since you're using the Sun container, I don't know how much tool support
you'll get out there. You've already felt one hurdle.

I've never ended up in a straitjacket myself, but I've heard stories. I
wouldn't do it myself; but I'd offer to let someone else do it.
